Incident.Summary: An insurance claim was granted to homeowners, and work was completed on their residence. Homeowners transferred payment funds from their account to a fraudulent construction company bank account. The company that completed the work on their residence did not receive payment.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: VIDEO/AUDIO RECORDINGS / Assisting officer Car B-62 // TFC Devin #7046// Body worn camera is not available // In car camera footage is not available. No other assisting troopers / officers at this time. ATTACHMENTS: MVA Printouts ofvictims. MSP 89A (Uniform Identity Fraud / Theft reporting Form). Maryland State Police Witness Statement completed by victim. Copy of Bank of America Transfer Request Authorization. Copy of Travelers Insurance Explanation of Payment. ($29,892.22) Copies of fraudulent emails between victim and suspect. VICTIM(S)/ COMPLAINANT: Digirolamo, Karen Ann, (DOB: 01/31/1962) Digirolamo, Joseph Michael, (DOB: 09/11/1987) WITNESS / NEIGHBORHOOD CHECKS: N/A / no witnesses SUSPECT(S): Suspect is unknown at this time. SCENE PROCESSING: - MSP Witness Statement was completed. (1) - MSP 89A completed. (1) - Copy of all provided documents by victims. NARRATIVE: On 01/10/2024, at approximately 11:38 hours, I, TFC Devin (#7046) of the Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack, was approached by two victims that requested to report a fraud incident. The two complainants were identified as, Digirolamo, Joseph Michael (DOB: 07/23/1960), and Digirolamo, Karen Ann (DOB: 10/31/1962). The complaints are husband and wife, and were identified by their Maryland Drivers Licenses. They both explained that they have been victims of a fraud / theft scheme involving a money transfer request that they completed using their personal bank account. Joseph and Karen have a shared checking account with Bank of America account number:(446022655194). Joseph explained that in early November of the year 2023, he had work completed through an insurance claim by Travelers Insurance (Claim #:14D1690), that was approved. The claim was to remodel two bathrooms inside his residence. The bathrooms were remodeled, and completed by a local company named, Andy Roofing Remodeling LLC. After the work was completed by this named company, a check was by sent to Joseph and Karen from their insurance for the payment of the job. Travelers Insurance deposited the agreed payment of $29,892.22 of US dollars into Josephs and Karens personal Bank of America account. On 12/13/2023 at approximately 14:20 hours, emails that appeared and fraudulently represented as, Andy Roofing Remodeling began to send emails to Joseph. The emails between Joseph and the company owner who identified as, Andrew Putman were exchanged from 12/14/2023 12/27/2023. The emails that were thought to be from Andrew Putman, and owner of Andy Roofing Remodeling were advising to receive electronic funds for the method of payment for the work that was completed. The money for payment was requested to be sent to via ACH/WFT payment for invoice 23-036. The account that was associated with this was Truist Bank account. On 01/08/2024, Joseph and Karen completed a wire money transfer from their Bank of America checking account number (446022655194) to Truist Bank account number (1340024818224). The money transfer that was sent to the account was $29,892.22 of US dollars. The recipient, and name on the account that received the payment was A.C.R LLC. The reference number for this transfer was for invoice 23-036. The account that the money was transferred into was Truist Bank account number (1340024818224). The transfer was completed, and the money was deposited into this named account. On 01/09/2024, Joseph and Karen discovered that Andy Roofing Remodeling never received the payment. Joseph began to investigate the email address that the emails were being sent from. The email was (aputman.acrlllc@gmail.com), and Joseph realized that there was an extra L inside this address. The extra L was placed, and made to represent ( text-decoration:underline">aputman.acrllc@gmail.com). At this time, Joseph realized that him and his wife were victims of a fraud scheme. Joseph and Karen reported this to Bank of America in hopes to stop the fraudulent transaction. The Bank of America advised to report this incident to the police and to be issued a case number for the investigation. The Bank of Americas fraud department is aware of this fraudulent activity, and is actively investigating. Joseph completed a Maryland State Police Witness Statement, and an MSP 89A, which can be found attached to this report. Joseph and Karen reported to Bank of America branch located at, 1070 W Patrick St, Frederick, MD 21703 to initially report the incident. At this bank location they spoke with the financial center manager, Cristin Silva. Silva reported to the Bank of Americas fraud department which issued Two seperate case numbers of (BHL240110002669) and, (12JAN2024-453-761). Account details of suspect account: Bank: Truist Bank Bank ID: 053101121 Address: 214 Tryon St, Charlotte, NC 28202. Account number: 1340024818224 Total amount that was transferred to account:$29,892.22US Dollars. Additional Reference Invoice 23-036 I provided Joseph and Karen with the case number, and all pertinent information. A Victims Witness Brochure was issued with the case number. All account information, and files have been added to the attachments section of this report. I will be contacting the Bank of America to further investigate this incident along with the involved construction company. In addition, have completed a court order request that has been sent to the Frederick County States Attorneys Office for approval. Once the court order is approved, I will report to the Truist Bank located in Walkersville, MD 21793. All the above events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland. CHARGES: Not applicable at this time until a suspect is identified. CASE STATUS: I respectfully request this case remain open pending further investigation.

On 01/18/2024, I, TFC Devin, received an approved Frederick County Court Order in reference to this case. I have attached a copy of the order to this report. The court order will be delivered to the Truist Bank on 01/19/2024. Case Status: I request this case remain open pending further investigation. All events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland.
